meanings.definition: A slight convexity in the shaft of a column.
meanings.sent1: The entasis of the column made it look taller and more graceful.
meanings.sent2: Architects often use entasis in columns to create an optical illusion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids painted fake entasis on the column to confuse passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an entasis that seemed to uplift everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The entasis of the column was so subtle, yet it changed the whole appearance of the building.

meanings.definition: The application of a slight convexity to a surface, such as a column or a road, to counteract the optical illusion of concavity.
meanings.sent1: The entasis of the road prevented drivers from feeling dizzy on the curved path.
meanings.sent2: Engineers carefully consider entasis when designing roads to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The artist added an unexpected entasis to the painting, creating a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an entasis that turned a negative situation into a positive one.
meanings.sent5: The entasis on the road made it seem like a fun rollercoaster ride for the passengers.
